paragraphs.title: Execution Console
paragraphs.text:
%md # Monitoring Queries with the Database Console Splice Machine jobs can be monitored, interrogated, and terminated in our Database Console. This notebook provides a quick introduction to the console, in these sections:
  • Accessing the Console
  • Drilling Down
  • Terminating an Active Job

msg.data:
Monitoring Queries with the Database Console

Splice Machine jobs can be monitored, interrogated, and terminated in our Database Console. This notebook provides a quick introduction to the console, in these sections:

  • Accessing the Console
  • Drilling Down
  • Terminating an Active Job

paragraphs.text:
%splicemachine
-- QUERY 02
select
	s_acctbal,
	s_name,
	n_name,
	p_partkey,
	p_mfgr,
	s_address,
	s_phone,
	s_comment
from
	TPCH1.part,
	TPCH1.supplier,
	TPCH1.partsupp,
	TPCH1.nation,
	TPCH1.region
where
	p_partkey = ps_partkey
	and s_suppkey = ps_suppkey
	and p_size = 15
	and p_type like '%BRASS'
	and s_nationkey = n_nationkey
	and n_regionkey = r_regionkey
	and r_name = 'EUROPE'
	and ps_supplycost = (
		select
			min(ps_supplycost)
		from
			TPCH1.partsupp,
			TPCH1.supplier,
			TPCH1.nation,
			TPCH1.region
		where
			p_partkey = ps_partkey
			and s_suppkey = ps_suppkey
			and s_nationkey = n_nationkey
			and n_regionkey = r_regionkey
			and r_name = 'EUROPE'
	)
order by
	s_acctbal desc,
	n_name,
	s_name,
	p_partkey
{limit 100}
-- END OF QUERY

%md ## Accessing the Database Console You can access the Splice Machine Database Console by clicking the DB Console button in your dashboard. The console initially displays the *Jobs* view, which looks like this: Some notes about the console display: * Queries are reported as *Jobs*. * Jobs that are still running are shown as *Active*, others are shown as *Completed*. * Each Job has some number of *Stages*. You can see the stages in a job by clicking a link in the job description, or you can view all stages for all jobs by clicking the *Stages* tab at the top of the console screen. * Each Stage has some number of *Tasks*, which are the most basic work units in the Spark Engine.

msg.data:
Accessing the Database Console

You can access the Splice Machine Database Console by clicking the DB Console button in your dashboard. The console initially displays the Jobs view, which looks like this:

Some notes about the console display:

  • Queries are reported as Jobs.
  • Jobs that are still running are shown as Active, others are shown as Completed.
  • Each Job has some number of Stages. You can see the stages in a job by clicking a link in the job description, or you can view all stages for all jobs by clicking the Stages tab at the top of the console screen.
  • Each Stage has some number of Tasks, which are the most basic work units in the Spark Engine.

paragraphs.text: %md ## Drilling Down You can drill down by clicking links; for example, if you click on the topmost Produce Result Set link in the above display, you'll see the *Job Details* screen, which displays the stages in the job: ### Viewing Stage Detail You can click the topmost link in the Job Stages screen to display the *Stage Details* screen: ### Viewing Stage Detail as a Directed Acyclic Graph (DAG) You can switch to a graphical (DAG) depiction of the information in a screen; for example, here's a graph of one stage of collecting statistics: ### Viewing Job Stages Graphically And here's a somewhat more interesting DAG view of a two-stage job: ### Displaying a Timeline View You can also view a timeline of the stage; for example:

msg.data:
Drilling Down

You can drill down by clicking links; for example, if you click on the topmost Produce Result Set link in the above display, you’ll see the Job Details screen, which displays the stages in the job:

Viewing Stage Detail

You can click the topmost link in the Job Stages screen to display the Stage Details screen:

Viewing Stage Detail as a Directed Acyclic Graph (DAG)

You can switch to a graphical (DAG) depiction of the information in a screen; for example, here’s a graph of one stage of collecting statistics:

Viewing Job Stages Graphically

And here’s a somewhat more interesting DAG view of a two-stage job:

Displaying a Timeline View

You can also view a timeline of the stage; for example:

paragraphs.text: %md ## Terminating an Active Job You can terminate an active job if you determine that something isn't working as expected. Simply access the *Jobs* tab while a job is actively running, and click the the *(kill)* text displayed next to the job description, as shown here: You'll be asked to confirm that you want to terminate that job.
%md ## Where to Go Next The next notebook in this presentation shows you how to use Apache Zeppelin notebooks for graphing and filtering the data in your Splice Machine databases.

msg.data:
Where to Go Next

The next notebook in this presentation shows you how to use Apache Zeppelin notebooks for graphing and filtering the data in your Splice Machine databases.
